channel.title: AT&T Long Lines & Bell Labs
channel.description: News and updates about AT&T Long Lines and Bell Labs history, technology, and innovation

item.title: New Microwave Tower Images Added to Gallery
item.description: We've added a collection of historic microwave relay tower images to our gallery, showcasing these engineering marvels of the AT&T Long Lines network.

item.title: The Transistor: Bell Labs' Revolutionary Invention
item.description: Explore the history of the transistor, invented at Bell Labs in 1947 by John Bardeen, Walter Brattain, and William Shockley, which revolutionized electronics and computing.

item.title: UNIX Operating System: A Bell Labs Innovation
item.description: Learn about UNIX, the groundbreaking operating system developed at Bell Labs by Ken Thompson and Dennis Ritchie in the late 1960s and early 1970s.

item.title: AT&T Long Lines History: Building America's Communications Network
item.description: Discover the fascinating history of AT&T Long Lines and how it built the nationwide communications infrastructure that connected America.
